description: The National Security Agency is shedding new light on what went into the search for Osama bin Laden through their podcast called, "No Such Podcast." Jon Darby is the former director of operations for the NSA and was the agency's chief of counterterrorism during the bin Laden operation. He joined CBS News to discuss the hunt for bin Laden.

description: Hurricane Francine is approaching Louisiana after strengthening in the Gulf of Mexico. Francine will grow into a Category 2 hurricane if it reaches winds above 96 mph. description: There are 71 major fires burning across the U.S., nine of them in California. In Los Angeles County, the Bridge Fire exploded late Tuesday from 3,000 acres to 34,000 acres in a matter of hours. Meanwhile the Airport Fire has grown to nearly 22,000 acres and is 0% contained.

description: CBS News spoke to a variety of voters in Bucks County, Pennsylvania, which is a competitive swing district. The voters agreed on some topics but said the candidates should have spoken more about policy and been less on the attack. All of them feel there should be another debate to tackle issues that weren't covered Wednesday night, like veteran support and bringing down the national debt.

description: Taylor Swift wrote that Vice President Kamala Harris "is a steady-handed, gifted leader and I believe we can accomplish so much more in this country if we are led by calm and not chaos."

description: What did voters think of Tuesday night's presidential debate between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump? CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion spoke with a focus group in Bucks County, Pennsylvania, to find out.

description: Taylor Swift said she plans to vote for Vice President Kamala Harris in a post to Instagram shortly after the first debate between Harris and former President Donald Trump Tuesday night. description: Former President Donald Trump falsely claimed Haitian immigrants are "eating the dogs" and pets in Springfield, Ohio, during the presidential debate Tuesday night.
